data.title: New inherited scene overwrites base by default
data.body:
When using "Scene"->"New Inherited Scene", saving appears to automatically overwrite the base scene file. The scene tab shows the base scene file name as well.
Reopening the file results in dependency issues and crashes.

Expected behavior on saving a new inherited scene would be to get the "Save New Scene..." dialog and enter a new file name.

data.title: [2.0 Alpha] [bug] [New scene system] Changing name of node that is a part of the base scene duplicate this node instead
data.body:
If you change name of the node that is part of the base scene, save inherited scene close it and reopen then this node will be duplicated (with new name). I know that there was no plans for allowing to change these names, but this behaviour don't seems to be expected as well.
Also don't know if call it a bug or a feature (since that might be handy) but for sure it feels like not planned behaviour.

To recreate:
1. Create scene from option "new inherited scene"
2. Change name of one of the nodes from base scene
3. Save and close scene
4. Reopen closed scene

Quick 40s wid that show this process: https://youtu.be/zqDUXy39d80

data.title: Reset property button displayed for all non-default values
data.body: When opening an existing scene, properties of nodes that are not instanced (and are not children of instanced nodes) that have a non-default value display the reset property button. Clicking it has no effect, but it won't disappear either.

data.title: Failed to compile HEAD (commit 7d8f187c)
Add support for soft bodies.
data.body: Soft bodies would be a useful addition to the physics engine?

data.title: Loading a project brings to an empty scene
data.body: Using latest HEAD (commit 52cc8e), when I open any demo project from the Project List window, Godot shows an empty scene. However, if I run the project (F5), it works OK.

data.title: [2.0 Alpha] [bug] [New scene system] Can't delete/modify nodes in previously saved scene
data.body:
Compilation from Oct 17, 2015 (17a90ddc0824bb51b5ea707f5d4d11aed301f91d commit)
I have 2 scenes, "Actor" and "Enemy". Enemy was created with "New Inherited Scene" option, with the base choosen as Actor. In enemy scene I added another scene with model (mesh/asset). 
Now when I open Actor scene I cant delete it's nodes.

Quick steps to reproduce problem:
1. Open "Actor.xscn" from sample project
2. Try to delete CollisionShape node.

Sample project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/NewSceneSystem2.7z

**UPDATE:**
Just like @WriterOfAlicrow noticed scene inheretance is not needed to reproduce this. Just save your scene reopen it and you will not be able to delete it's nodes. (changed title a little to reflect this)

data.title: GDScript export hints: Add float w/ ease, remove duplicate, adapt multiline to established format
data.body:
A pull request from not too long ago added `flags` and `multiline` export hints, both of which are very useful. However:
-  Bitmasks were already available using `export(int, FLAGS) var bitmask`. As far as I can see, there is no difference between the two, and having duplicate functionality seems like a bad idea to me. This change deletes the duplicate.
  When this pull request is dealt with, I'm also going to update the `export var` section of the GDScript doc page to avoid this kind of confusion in the future.
-  The `multline` hint doesn't use the default syntax which has the actual type followed by the all-caps hint: `export(String, MULTILINE)` versus `export(multiline)`.
  This change adapts the the multi-line export hint to the established format.

I'm hoping to get these changed while they're not yet part of a stable release and people using the release builds start using them.
-  In addition, this change also adds exporting real numbers with easing hint: `export(float, EASE) var takeiteasy`. Requested in and closes #2403.

data.title: ShaderGraphNodes Color Uniform broken.
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Initially seen in 2.0 alpha 2015-10-03

 Testing material shader graphs on godot 2.0 and I noticed that the color uniform node is broken. Blue does not work and alpha cannot connect.

I'm guessing that blue and alpha channels got transposed since it acts like blue is at 255.

Changing the alpha channel does nothing.

example:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3i2iHqe6FaubjNDQUNRUDdSMTg/view?usp=sharing

data.title: Navigation cost per tile
data.body:
Right now the navigation logic chooses the shortest path possible on a tilemap but under certain circumstances this isn't always the best one.
Imagine the player needs to cross a river. The shortest way would be to wade just right through it. But if there is a bridge in vicinity it would be better to cross the bridge instead of the river (it it isn't blocked some way).
To achieve this tiles would need a property that marks the cost of passing it.

data.title: Rich Text Label Improvments
data.body:
Add meta_enter()/meta_exit() events.
This will allow people to show tooltips when the user hovers over text.

So when you have a label with.
[url=info://enemy/plonker]Plonkers[/url]
You could add a tool tip on hover to quickly explain what Plonkers are.

More control over [url] style. Having the underline or hand icon might not be consistent with your game's overall visual style the user should be able to change it.

3. Open gd file which is not already opened.

data.title: Default ui_focus_next and ui_focus_prev Misreport
Can't Press TextureButtons with Negative Scale
data.body:
If you have a TextureButton with a scale whose x or y contains a negative value, you can't click on it.

To demonstrate this, take an empty project, create two TextureButtons, one named "Normal" and the other named "Flipped". Set their Normal texture to whatever you'd like (I used the default icon.png for both), then add the following code to the scene:

```
func _ready():
    get_node("Normal").connect("pressed", self, "button_pressed")
    get_node("Flipped").set_scale(Vector2(1, -1))
    get_node("Flipped").connect("pressed", self, "button_pressed")

func button_pressed():
    print("A button was pressed.")
```

The print statement will happen for the Normal button but not for the Flipped button. This seems to happen regardless of whether the scale was set in the editor or via code, as long as at least one of the values is negative. Things work fine with arbitrary positive values.

data.title: Popup Menu children
data.body:
If you create a scene and make the first node a popup menu and move the menu before adding children, It will automatically click the popup menu when you try to click on the children of the node.

In godot stable 1.1

data.title: Expose softness parameter of pin joint to the editor.
data.body: This parameter was already presented inside PinJoint and it was always set to 0. So I played with it and decided to expose it to the editor. It allows some fine tuning of joint and decreases impulses inside. The actual behaviour depends on "bias" value. If bias is trying to correct position errors by introducing some energy into the system, softness in the opposite decreases the final impulse. So together they act a bit like spring. If bias introduce too much energy and make simulation unstable some softness may make it stable again.

data.title: Search through all currently opened scripts
data.body: When you press control+f and search something wile scripting, it only looks through the script you are looking at. I think it would be a nice time-saver if there was an option to look through all scripts that are currently opened.

data.title: AnimationPlayer not working right fo ranimations that last less than 1 second
data.body:
it's all in the title
When i tried that, the animation would simply not play. If i extended the animation time to be more than 1 second, it worked (even if all the animation points were before 1 second).

data.title: Add type mask customization to RayCast2D
data.body:
`RayCast2D` currently uses the default ray cast type mask `TYPE_MASK_COLLISION`, which does not include `TYPE_MASK_AREA`. This makes it impossible to use the node to check for collision with `Area2D` nodes.

This change adds full customization of the object type mask used for the raycast.

Depends on #2587 for `Area2D` collision to work properly.

data.title: [BUG] (2.0alpha) - Test_Screen_Size & Stretch_Mode
data.body:
If the test_width & test_height properties are set and the stretch_mode is 2d or Display, the screen will be stretched but the image will be missing the top and bottom half.

It was working on 1.1. I'm using a 1024x600 full resolution and a test resolution of 512x300 with stretch_mode 2D and stretch_aspect: keep.

data.title: Fix Area/Area2D mask matching
data.body:
Currently, `Area2DSW` has its non-existent `BodyMode` checked like a `Body2DSW`. This prevents, for example, performing raycasts only for `Area2D`s.

This change has the relevant function return as soon as all checks needed for `Area2DSW` are done.

Fixes #1906.

(Curiously, setting the object type mask to `TYPE_MASK_AREA | TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY` works as a workaround to this bugâ€Šâ€”â€Šapparently calling `get_mode()` on a `Area2DSW` casted to a `Body2DSW` returns `TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY`? No idea what happens hereâ€¦)
